They said they are streamlining classes, creating subgroups organized into big classes. In most games, be it RPG, MMORPG or MOBAs Assasins are the mage killers, they are designed for it. They seem to want the same thing here, which is not exactly bad - I mean, it makes sense - But Zed kit is obnoxious to play against and they should nerf the hell out of it so he can pay for all that mobility and safety. The best way we have to dislike this change is giving dear Zed a 90%+ ban rate tho

This buff isn't aimed only at Zed, either. Look at the new mage changes, how many of them are based on debuffs?
Cassiopeia, Brand, Malzahar, Vel'koz have a small debuff system that empowers them, outside of CC. QSS could remove those things.

Few things were more frustrating than being a mage murdering an ADC just to have him cleanse out with QSS your ignite, debuffs and kill you with basic attacks. This change is good

{{item:3157}} 
It should be painfully obvious.

Your antiZed is Zhonya's, it needn't be said.
Now in 6.9 ,the AP on ZH is decreased on Zhonya's (from 100 to 70) but still good (Zed's squishy af) and really the only thing I have issue with is the cooldown increase on ZH's active because meanwhile in Zedland, his ult at max rank is on an 80 sec CD BEFORE items (need I remind you Zed does build a little CDR). ZH is 120 sec in 6.9 (up from 90). _**Zed's ultimate's CD will NEED to be nerfed.**_ I've played Zed though I'm no expert and I honestly feel little to no punishment for abusing his ult.

Anyways, ZH changes in 6.9 makes Zhonya's more a counter/utility item when you really need it (vs Zeds) while the decreased AP means it's going to be less of an impulse buy on pretty much every mage that only really wants an excuse to be invulnerable for second. `-`

ALSO! Zhonya's is getting cheaper in the 6.9 so your squishy champs can build it faster vs Zeds. It's still 3000g, but faster is faster.
Zhonya's also gives you 10% CDR so you may have more just that little bit extra breathing room to make actual plays against a Zed.


Though I do agree how his reply seems to be centered around AD based champs. I'm guessing those are his mains, which is worrying.
That or he doesn't want to be responsible for even more people going Zhonya's.

QSS was actually too strong, I don't know how anybody thought it was reasonable

Assassins should be able to kill carries that get caught, that's the entire purpose of an Assassin. We're in such an ADC-spoiled meta that it's almost like we expect ADCs to be able to counter everything and its mother.

If ADCs can so easily counter Zed, then what's the counter to ADCs? Piling on them with 2-3 players and hoping the other team isn't looking? Countering Assassins is the work of the front line and support, it shouldn't be something carries can do by themselves.

I agree 100% the item was too strong, granting marksmen, or even assassins he ability to remove all debuffs or cc, while giving a boatload of stats. As others said it isn't fair for zed's ult to be completely nullified against a class of champions who he is supposed to be able to assasinate, but it sort of kept him in check. We'll see I guess.

Adc already got plenty of possibilities to counter assassins. 
Banshees, GA, now even steraks, positioning, kiting. 
Problem is, the vast majority of player (bronze and silver) can't position well nor peel for their squishy carries.

Although it isnt right for an entire ultimate to be removed by an item, this is just really really really concerning...  Duskblade + Zed Ult late game will actually be disgusting.  Zed will probably get nerfed a lot after this change tbh.
Do you hear that? That the sound of {{champion:48}} rejoicing in clamorous fashion.

mercurial is far too strong anyways. though i feel they should have just reduced the ad value further to either 50 or 55.

its supposed to be a situational, complementary item against heavy cc/lockdown comps. not an item that fits into every marksmen build.
remove speed buff and either nerf dmg or defense simple...

I know it still removes {{champion:90}} ult still, but what about {{champion:72}}? Being able to just go "nope" to his ult is one of the main reasons he isn't bothered with because he essentially doesn't even have an ult.

and unlike Zed, he can't just 100-0 someone with his other abilities and auto attacks.

As someone who plays Skarner very often, you don't *need* your ultimate to force a kill or pressure a team, you can use your ultimate even as a peeling tool against divers and assasins who are likely to not have QSS. If you manage to reach a mage or an ADC in a teamfight, chances are you're going to die soon due to going far too deep. There is more to Skarner than his ultimate, but everyone seems to have this misconception

You know, Zed's ult is not the only thing that Qss could cleanse and save you from... Vlad's ult, Fiora's Ult, Darius' passive, Vayne's passive, Brand's passive, Ignite, Exhaust. All those are important too you know.
I didn't know you could cleanse a vayne and darius passive with QSS....

Well, it does and it was veeery satisfying. And also a dirty trick that few knew... I still wish to see the look on that Darius' face when i cleansed his passive at  4 stacks right before his Q hit and denied him his bloodrage only to kill him right after...

If you thought "why not cleanse it when it reached 5 to deny his ult damage" the answer is, his passive bloodrage remains on even if you cleanse the 5 stacks and it is of course instantly reapplied at max stacks if he hits you in the 5 seconds bloodrage is active only to renew the duration and of course dunk you. And no, i will not ever call it noxian might. Bloodrage was so badass, why did they even haveto change it?

I mean that is pretty dumb if you think about it

If Darius manages to touch an ADC 4-5 times, he deserves the kill.

Vayne's passive gives her bonus movement speed when moving towards nearby, visible enemy champions.
